name: Ayres Hotel Chino Hills

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I were stunned at how beautiful our room was for such an affordable price. We joked about how we could live there long term. It had a spacious suite and luxurious bed with the softest pillows I have ever experienced in a hotel (and I've been all over the world!) The comforter was heaven and not the gross bedspreads that never get washed. The color pallet was calming and I was impressed with the updated countertops and lighting system. Even though we were only there for one night, we were determined to take advantage of all the amenities the hotel offered. A widescreen flat tv, fridge, coffee maker, microwave, hairdryer, office space, tub! This place is perfect for lone travelers as well as a romantic getaway. Can I take the Ayres everywhere we go!? Thanks again!
reviews.title: A winner!

reviews.text: Chino Hills has a limited selection of hotels available, so we read the reviews and decided on the Ayers. I cannot tell you it was the worst hotel in Chino Hills but I can tell you that I would not stay here again. Definitely do NOT stay here for the breakfast. The bagels/bread was stale. They have cook to order eggs which my husband said were fine, but the potatoes served with the eggs were bland and cold. The orange juice was not available. The cereal had been in the container for a long while. All together a miserable experience.
reviews.title: No bugs, but . . .

reviews.text: The front desk was manned by a bored employee, who did nothing to make us feel welcome, I can say that the rooms were large and for the most part clean. if I were to stay in Chino Hills again, it would not be here.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

reviews.text: I agree with the other reviews that this is a very clean hotel. The bed was extremely comfortable. We asked for extra towels in our reservation, which we were given at the front desk as well as in the room when we arrived. We heard no noise from the nearby freeway, although we were on the opposite side. I did not use the fitness center but it appeared to be well-equipped with lots of free weights and several pieces of cardio equipment. I only have two minor issues that I post here as constructive feedback for the hotel. One is the availability of the complimentary breakfast. We stayed from the Thursday night before Christmas Sunday through the following Tuesday morning and never took advantage of it because as we understood it breakfast was from 6AM to 9AM. We are not morning people, particularly while on vacation. It would have been nice to have it open until 10AM, even if only on the weekends (unless it was and we just misunderstood?) The Corner Bakery that's in the same parking lot as the hotel, however, has GREAT food. Also, a lot of hotels leave bottled water in the rooms, which I don't mind paying for. This would be a nice touch as, otherwise, I can't think of anything else that would have improved our stay at this very nice hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: This hotel is extremely clean including bed linens, carpets and bathrooms. The brand/model of mattresses that they use is so comfortable we would like to buy one. This may not be important to many people but I find the lobby to be very warm and inviting. We also enjoy the quality of the complementary breakfast although there is no waffle maker which one of the other local hotels provides. There are lots of good restaurants and shopping close by. Also, if you are a Christian looking for a church in this area, my daughter and her family attend Calvary Chapel Chino Hills which is close by. You will truly be inspired by Pastor Jack. I'm sure the hotel can provide you with address. We have stayed here twice now and will consider it in the future since we have family in Chino Hills.
reviews.title: such a great place to stay

reviews.text: We had our 1st stay at the Ayers Hotel in Chino Hills and enjoyed ourselves thoroughly. The front desk staff brought smiles to our faces, the room was excellent with very comfortable beds. Breakfast the next morning was delicious. The fitness center worked well for myself and my husband. Overall I give the 10 out of 10 stars!!!! We recommend Ayers Hotel and will be back.
reviews.title: Enjoyed staying at Ayers Hotel in Chino Hills

reviews.text: Last year my sister paid for our room at Ayres Yorba Linda. We loved it so much we decided to make it an annual event; but this year we stayed at the Ayres in Chino Hills. EXCELLENT CHOICE!! Everyone made us feel at home the minute we walked in the front door. Lovely decor, very clean, and delicious food. Norm loved being able to work at the desk in our suite. We will be back !
reviews.title: Wonderful Experience at Ayres Hotel Chino Hills!!

reviews.text: Our stay at the Ayres Hotel in Chino Hills was great. Our daughter was playing a tournament at BLD and this was a last minute(3 days before) reservation. They were very accomodating and meeting our needs. Most impressive was I ran into a parent from our organization on anothere team and she indicated that her and several other parents called that same night to see if they had rooms still available. They not only had rooms for them, they offered them the same rate as our team for their one night stay, plus breakfast. The tournament ended up getting rained out the next morning, however worth the stay! Girls had a great time. Hotel, service, rooms and breakfast was exceptional.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: My stay at the Ayres Hotel Chino Hills was the best. It was close to my work location and the local food varity was wonderful. The breakfast was just as wonderful. All the employees were cheerful and very helpful. Shopping was close. Your staff was helpful knowledgeable and supportive in every way possible. I will continue to stay there for all my business trips.
reviews.title: Ayres Hotel Chino Hills Great Experience To Have!!!!!!!

reviews.text: The exersice room was state of the art equipment. Clean and fresh..
reviews.title: good experience with Ayres

reviews.text: We just needed to spend one night in Chino Hills for an event at the local high school. I have to admit, when I searched for lodging in the area and all that I found were two hotels, both rated 2 or 3 stars, I didn't expect much! But the Ayres was perfectly clean, the rooms nice and big, and we got a great night's sleep. The hot breakfast the next morning was actually unexpected. I had only indicated one guest in the room as I was searching for hotels and didn't change that when I made the reservation although I did have my teenage daughter with me. The manager was perfectly nice about giving me an extra breakfast pass and it was a great way to start the morning. For the price, our stay at the Ayres was a GREAT value. The only reason I wouldn't give 5 stars is because I reserve those for luxury hotels. But this WAS a great stay.
reviews.title: Far better than expected

reviews.text: We arrived at this hotel after choosing it because of it's proximity to our destination. We found it to be very nicely appointed. Rooms were very spacious and clean. The breakfast was better than expected although the attendant on our third morning was a bit rude even though she tried to hide it with a put on smile. The front desk staff were very accommodating and helpful. The only thing negative is that there was a traveling baseball team of young boys that made it impossible to sleep right up to midnight.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel

reviews.text: Overall it was a very good value and I would recommend that you give it a try.
reviews.title: Above and Beyond

reviews.text: We stayed at the Ayres for a baseball tournament at Big League Dreams. This hotel was less than 10 minutes from the park and at a great location for nearby dining. The staff went above and beyond to allow our team to have a gathering in the food room. We wanted to have a team dinner, Monique helped us on very little notice. The boys were able to swim and we brought in food. Thank you Ayres, Chino Hills for everything you did for our team. We really enjoyed our stay. I would highly recommend this hotel for your next stay for any sporting event held at BLD.
reviews.title: FABULOUS hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at Ayres for Legends Cup Soccer Tournament and the hotel was fantastic. Super nice, clean, elegant, great with kids, wonderful hot breakfast with fresh pancakes and eggs plus, free internet. Kids had a great time. Very pretty hotel and kid/sports friendly. Hard to find combination and I look forward to staying there again and I am hard to please!
reviews.title: One night at the Ayres Hotel Chino Hills

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: People, this hotel was beautiful. Clean ... just lovely! We have been in a lot of hotels over the past few years and his is #1. We didn't know the name, but I'll tell you that I we will look for another when next traveling. There was a lovely Happy Hour. The breakfast was cooked to order and very nice! The staff was great. The only down side was that when we arrived early they could give us a room if we paid $30 dollars. When we said no, suddenly there was no rooms....in the end the room was not ready until 3:35 pm....but, other than that, it was very very nice!
reviews.title: Nicest hotel I've been in for years!

reviews.text: Wow! Great: location, price, staff, suite, free breakfast, free happy hour! The entire stay was really nice. Its warm colors and deocor made me feel "at home" and not at a"inn", the staff was very nice and smiling. And, it was clean! Clean from the moment i walked in til i checked out, everything seemed new and clean. The rooms have microwave and fridge, my fridge made a little noise, but overall the stay was great! I'm staying there again next week and i'm planning to booking all of my other stays in that area at the Ayres, Chino Hills.
reviews.title: GREAT! You will love this place!!!

reviews.text: New hotel. Very friendly staff. Great location with plenty of restaurants close by. Very pleased with this hotel. I've stayed at an Ayres Hotel before in Ontario and this property is brand new and much nicer.
reviews.title: Great Choice

reviews.text: We have stayed in this hotel a couple of times for my boy's baseball tournaments. It was recommended to us by other traveling teams. It is clean, the rooms are spacey, and the staff is nice. Lots of restaurants close by and it's less than five minutes away from Big League Dreams.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: This hotel is a great place to stay. Very clean and affordable
reviews.title: Beautiful stay. Great price!

description: Welcome to the Ayres Hotel Chino Hills! This unique hotel oasis combines the comforts and conveniences of home with the warm hospitality you’ve come to expect from the Ayres name. Whether you’re here for a short business visit or a long, relaxing retreat, you’ll find all of the luxurious guest rooms at Ayres Hotel Chino Hills are impeccably appointed with a full suite of complimentary amenities including our signature, triple sheeted Ayres Dream Sleeper beds, flat screen TVs, refrigerators, coffeemakers, well lit work desks and Wifi, iHomes, hairdryers, and curved shower rods. And every morning you will start your day right with our complimentary full American breakfast.The nearby Big League Dreams ballpark beckons sports lovers of any age. Mimicking 6 major league stadiums such as Fenway Park, Yankee Stadium, and Wrigley Field the Big League Dreams ballpark is the ideal place for a sports enthusiast to spend their day in Chino Hills. If sports aren't your thing, the Chino Hills State Park is only 3 miles away and is the perfect open space area for a family or romantic picnic with a picturesque view of the Santa Ana Canyon. The Ayres Chino Hills has it all; from shopping at the Shoppes at Chino Hills, to golfing the El Prado Golf Course, even to splashing around at Raging Waters this is one Inland Empire destination that will not leave you wanting more.
